intro: Odontosoria uncinella, commonly known as the hooked spleenwort, is a fern that belongs to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces sporangia on the undersides of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or tree trunks. Odontosoria uncinella is widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
